revised_title: On the Cohesive Attraction and Aggregation of Blood-Corpuscles
tldr: The author investigates the aggregation of blood-corpuscles and their behavior in different forms, concluding that cohesive attraction and physical laws are responsible for the phenomena, rather than an attractive force or energy. The study includes experiments with disk-shaped bodies and spherical vesicles to demonstrate the role of shape and attraction in the formation of rouleaux and other arrangements.
